title: A QUAINT LITTLE VILLAGE SLAYING
description: Deductive Logico traveled to Dame Obsidian's quaint little village, and immediately, Logico learned a new word: "vicar." He didn't know what it meant, but he knew how to use it in a sentence, like, "The vicar has been murdered, and I'm going to find whodunit."

suspects.name: DAME OBSIDIAN
suspects.description: One of her most famous books is about a mystery writer who frames an innocent magician. Suspicious!

suspects.name: DEACON VERDIGRIS
suspects.description: A deacon in the church. She handles the parishioners' donations and, sometimes, their secrets.

suspects.name: EARL GREY
suspects.description: He comes from a long line of Earl Greys. Yes, of the tea. No, he doesn't sign autographs. But he'll give you a free bag if you ask.

weapons.name: A BOTTLE OF CYANIDE
weapons.description: It's almond-scented poison, but it can also get rid of headaches (like your husband).

weapons.name: A PAIR OF GARDENING SHEARS
weapons.description: Gardening is a great hobby. But honestly, it's easier to get good tomatoes by killing for them.

weapons.name: YARN
weapons.description: Sometimes, when you realize you've missed a stitch, you could just strangle somebody.

locations.name: THE MANOR HOUSE
locations.description: The dame's. It's filled with giant portraits of many generations of dead rich white guys.

locations.name: THE CHAPEL
locations.description: A tiny church filled with stained-glass windows and secrets.

locations.name: THE ANCIENT RUINS
locations.description: These same standing stones again! Each of them has a strange labyrinth carved on its side.

clues: Logico smelled almonds beneath a stained-glass window.
Dame Obsidian was not in her manor house. Or any manor house, for that matter.
Yes, he owned a tea empire, but Earl Grey never gardened, and he wouldn't be caught dead holding a pair of shears.
Deacon Verdigris was visiting the ancient ruins to research an article he was writing about the local pagan practices prior to the arrival of the church.
The vicar was strangled—most embarrassingly—by a roll of yarn.
